attributes.action: Insurance companies to payout Business Interruption Claims caused by Covid-19
attributes.additional_details: Government intervention is required to get the insurance providers to honour business interruption policies that were taken out businesses precisely for situations such as the one businesses find themselves in today for no fault of their own.
attributes.background: Businesses have suffered heavy financial losses as a result of Covid-19 and it associated impact. Businesses took out Business Interruption Insurance for situations such as this. For insurance companies to now refuse to pay out is accepting the unacceptable. Government intervention is needed

rejection.details:
The decision to pay out under a policy is one for individual insurance companies, not the UK Government or Parliament. If you are unhappy with the decision of your insurer you should complain directly to them. If you are unsatisfied with how an insurer responds to your complaint you may wish to contact the financial ombudsman: https://www.financial-ombudsman.org.uk/businesses/complaints-deal/insurance

You can find out what Government support is available for businesses as a result of the coronavirus here: https://www.businesssupport.gov.uk/

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You may wish to sign this petition calling on the Government to "Provide all small companies not entitled to existing support a grant of £25,000"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316889
